description.narrative: Uniting an initiative from the African Fruit Fly Program, at improving the management of fruit flies in eastern and southern Africa, this proposed research aims at disseminating knowledge about fruit flies and to establish a foundation for collaboration between researchers, extension and farmers. Horticulture production in east Africa is an increasing domestic income, generating chances to afford education, health care and provides financial opportunities in rural areas. By the introduction of the African invasive fruit fly, Bactrocera invadens, the horticultural production is threated, both for domestic consumption and export. Several hypotheses and assumptions for the management of this devastating fruit fly species do exist but are sparsely used. This project aims to validate the techniques in a local context together with farmers, extensionists and researchers in Kenya and Ethiopia.
